intro: Pappobolus schillingii, commonly known as the Schilling's pappobolus, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by wind, a feature typical of many members of its family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists.
